name: DocumentListener
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
DocumentListener
description: An ongoing listen operation on a document reference. This is returned by calling DocumentReference#listen.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

listener = nyc_ref.listen do |snapshot|
  puts "The population of #{snapshot[:name]} "
  puts "is #{snapshot[:population]}."
end

# When ready, stop the listen operation and close the stream.
listener.stop

require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference

  puts "is #{snapshot[:population]}."
end

# When ready, stop the listen operation and close the stream.
listener.stop

methods.name: stopped?
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
DocumentListener#stopped?
methods.description: Whether the client has stopped listening for changes.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

listener = nyc_ref.listen do |snapshot|
  puts "The population of #{snapshot[:name]} "
  puts "is #{snapshot[:population]}."
end

# Checks if the listener is stopped.
listener.stopped? #=> false

# When ready, stop the listen operation and close the stream.
listener.stop

# Checks if the listener is stopped.
listener.stopped? #=> true
